description: `furo-ui5-table` display entities in a ui5-table ```html Custom Title ``` ## Attributes which are taken from `ui5-table-column` **field** Define the field you want to bind. `*` is the root of the repeated field. **context** Set a context for the type renderer. The default value is `cell`. **renderer** Set a specific renderer component for the column. If not set, the renderer is evaluated from the type of the bound field.
name: FuroUi5Table

members.name: focus
members.description: Focuses the header of the table

members.name: _getSpecFieldFromPath
members.description: resolves a field specification with the given path

members.name: mode
members.description:
Defines the mode of the component.

Available options are:
- MultiSelect
- SingleSelect
- None

members.name: noDataText
members.description:
Defines the text that will be displayed when there is no data.
string

members.name: stickyColumnHeader
members.description: Determines whether the column headers remain fixed at the top of the page during vertical scrolling as long as the Web Component is in the viewport.

events.name: data-loaded
events.description: Fired when the data is loaded into data table. The event detail contains the data table self.
Fired when the ArrowDown is pressed on the last row. The event detail is the original entity of the row
events.name: arrow-down-on-last-row

events.description: Fired when the row is selected. The event detail is the original entity of the row.
events.name: tablerow-selected

events.description: Fired when the ArrowUp is pressed on the first row. The event detail is the original entity of the row
events.name: arrow-up-on-first-row

events.description: Fired when the row selection in MultiSelect mode was changed
events.name: rows-selected

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description:
Defines the mode of the component.

Available options are:
- MultiSelect
- SingleSelect
- None

attributes.name: no-data-text
attributes.description:
Defines the text that will be displayed when there is no data.
string

attributes.name: sticky-column-header
attributes.description: Determines whether the column headers remain fixed at the top of the page during vertical scrolling as long as the Web Component is in the viewport.

summary: Display repeated fields in a table
